Description: Whether all image files were successfully preloaded for the subject.
The jsPsych plugin used to run the trial.
The trial index for the trial.

Allowed Values: strictly increasing set of integers for each subject
Description: The total time elapsed by the end of the trial since the start of the experiment.
This is used internally by jsPsych to find data. Not relevant to analysis.
Originally, the prolific ID of the subject. This has been anonymized.
The prolific study ID.
The prolific session ID.
Which condition the participant was assigned to.
A list of the two features that are category-relevant
The bee group variables specify which types of bees are dangerous. If X, then this feature is not relevant. A = antennae, B = bald
The bee group variables specify which types of bees are dangerous. If X, then this feature is not relevant. 1= 1 pair of wings, 2 = 2 pairs of wings
The bee group variables specify which types of bees are dangerous. If X, then this feature is not relevant. S = stripes, D = dots
The bee group variables specify which types of bees are dangerous. If X, then this feature is not relevant. F = few, M = many
The amount of bonus this participant earned.
For the preloading trials, whether the experiment timed out before preloading was successful.
Specifies a list of image files that failed to load if success is false.
Specifies audio files that failed to preload. Not relevant to this experiment.
Specifies video files that failed to preload. Not relevant to this experiment.
The response time of the subject in milliseconds for that trial
A representation of the stimulus shown on the screen. Usually an HTML-formatted string or path to an image file
For the bee harvesting trials, 0 = harvest & 1 = avoid.
Shows the time spent on each page of the instructions for the instructions plugin trials. Also shows if the participant went backwards to review the instructions
Records the order that questions were asked. Since question order was not randomized in this experiment it is not relevant.
For the instructions quiz, records TRUE if all answers are correct, FALSE otherwise.
For the learning phase, records the action the participant took on each trial

Allowed Values: good-avoid or good-harvest or bad-avoid or bad-harvest
Description: For the learning phase, records the value of the action and action together.
A randomly generated subject ID. Redundant with the subject_id column.
